name: places/ChIJjUGQIPhYwokRHeD9KPkNSfE
adrFormatAddress: 870 7th Ave, New York, NY 10019-4369, USA

editorialSummary.text: Sleek, modern rooms in a 1920s hotel with a fitness center, a hip lounge & a casual cafe.

originalText.text: My family and I had a wonderful three night stay at Park Central. When we arrived, I was excited and happy to hear some great music when I stepped out of the car. I love dancing and began to move to the music. The doorman joined in and we laughed and smiled our way into the hotel. Emanuel checked us in and helped with our requests. He was friendly efficient and professional. I love the fresh and fragrant lobby area. My room was comfortable, clean and nice!! I enjoyed time sitting in the lobby and bar area as well. I love staying here when we travel to New York. It's a great location and I enjoyed my time.

text.text: My family and I had a wonderful three night stay at Park Central. When we arrived, I was excited and happy to hear some great music when I stepped out of the car. I love dancing and began to move to the music. The doorman joined in and we laughed and smiled our way into the hotel. Emanuel checked us in and helped with our requests. He was friendly efficient and professional. I love the fresh and fragrant lobby area. My room was comfortable, clean and nice!! I enjoyed time sitting in the lobby and bar area as well. I love staying here when we travel to New York. It's a great location and I enjoyed my time.

originalText.text: The customer service was really nice. I made a booking for one room few minutes before 12 midnight but the other 2 rooms was not able to push thru. The customer service said she will indicate that we will arrive before 1 am and will indicate that we still need two rooms. Upon arrival, the manager and the front desk was able to accommodate all of us. The location is great since diner and stores were just few blocks away. The rooms were fine too. The only problem we had was the elevator issue. There is only one elevator working. I remember using their service elevator (which was advised by one of their staff) . If you are in the rush then it's probably a huge problem. Otherwise, our stay in this hotel was great.(The photo was taken from our window.)

originalText.text: Terrible hotel. Only one elevator working the whole time I was there. My room had no heat. It didn't work, it didn't even come on. It's February. I was freezing. Space heater helped some, but still uncomfortable. Non stop construction noise, all day and night long. I try to roll with things, but this was a miserable stay. Front desk does not answer the phone as well. Good luck getting assistance. The shower though, was really good. Instant hot water, consistent temp. That was a nice surprise.

text.text: Terrible hotel. Only one elevator working the whole time I was there. My room had no heat. It didn't work, it didn't even come on. It's February. I was freezing. Space heater helped some, but still uncomfortable. Non stop construction noise, all day and night long. I try to roll with things, but this was a miserable stay. Front desk does not answer the phone as well. Good luck getting assistance. The shower though, was really good. Instant hot water, consistent temp. That was a nice surprise.

originalText.text: Lots of reviews complaining about the elevators seem to be overblown - the most we waited for elevators was 3-4 minutes, and only at check-out time on a Sunday.  Very centrally located, clean, safe, just lacking a little bit of attention to detail in the rooms (some damage, felt a little dated, chips on doors, etc.) but nothing major.  They stored our baggage for free before check-in as well as after check-out, which was very helpful.. and all staff interactions were top notch. Highly recommend!

text.text: Lots of reviews complaining about the elevators seem to be overblown - the most we waited for elevators was 3-4 minutes, and only at check-out time on a Sunday.  Very centrally located, clean, safe, just lacking a little bit of attention to detail in the rooms (some damage, felt a little dated, chips on doors, etc.) but nothing major.  They stored our baggage for free before check-in as well as after check-out, which was very helpful.. and all staff interactions were top notch. Highly recommend!

originalText.text: Great location. Lots to eat around the hotel and just a short walk to time square. Our tv, phone, and main lamp in the room were not working. We were there for only 2 nights and didn’t spend much time in our room so we didn’t feel it necessary to ask to swap rooms. We did get charged with a smoking fee in our room for almost $600 although none of us in the room are smokers of any kind.The First Lady we talked about the issue with was extremely rude and was not willing to work with us about the fees. She showed us when the detectors in our room “detected smoke” & it was at a time when we were not even at the hotel. When asking them to look at their cameras to see what time we walked in the hotel (we knew almost to the minute we arrived back) she claimed they didn’t work.  We finally asked to speak to someone else. Emanuel was beyond helpful!! He listened to us patiently while we made our complaints and was extremely accommodating, understanding and willing to work with us. He was kind and easy to talk to. If you so stay here I would ask for him for anything you need.
